metadata.titel_preek: Good Works and Words: Signs of the End

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The cosmic battle where God intervenes to destroy the Power of Evil (the Lawless One) and establishes His kingdom, transforming the end from human annihilation into divine restoration.

tekstueel_bewijs: the Lord Jesus will slay him with the breath of his mouth
May our Lord Jesus Christ himself... comfort your hearts and establish them

object.identificatie: The restoration of the world and the comfort/establishment of the believers.
tekstueel_bewijs: comfort your hearts and establish them in every good work and word
a day of restoration and not a day of doom

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Divine Will
tekstueel_bewijs: The future is coming to us, from God. God is creating the future.

ontvanger.identificatie: The Church / The Thessalonians / The Hearers
tekstueel_bewijs: make us children of God and heirs of eternal life

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit (implied in the comfort) and the 'signs' of good works.
tekstueel_bewijs: good works and words are signs of the victory of the Lord Jesus Christ

tegenstander.identificatie: The Lawless One / Satan / The Power of Sin and Death
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad habits but an archetypal Power of Evil that seeks to destroy God's handiwork and lead to extinction.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Believers performing 'good works and words' as resistance to evil in the 'meantime'.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is explicitly framed as a 'sign' or 'acting out' of the primary program's victory. It is a consequence, not a condition.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Good Works/Spirit → Jesus Christ ← Lawless One/Satan
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: Jesus Christ → Destruction of Evil/Establishment of Saints

voorbeelden_god_subject: the Lord Jesus will slay him
God destroys the world but raises the dead
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we must think about these things

voorbeelden: We don’t want to think about these things, but we must.
The Thessalonian community is full of enthusiasm.
Paul wants us to understand that God has an active, personal Enemy.
May our Lord Jesus Christ... establish them
good works and words are given us to perform

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes the 'Pouvoir' (Power/Ability) as a gift from Christ. The human 'doing' is a participation in a power already exercised by the Subject (Christ).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the fear of S2 (Nuclear extinction) to the revelation of S1 (God's Judgment as hope), showing that ~S2 (Good works) are the present echoes of S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension between human destruction and divine judgment is resolved by Christ's 'breath,' which slays the lawless one.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the sermon takes the threat of nuclear annihilation and cosmic evil as 'Heavy Opponents'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It explicitly corrects the anthropocentric view that humans create the future, asserting that the future is a gift from God.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential Exemplarism in the two women's stories
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: each of them has done something extraordinarily kind

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: You and I are not creating the future. The future is coming to us, from God.
these good works and good words are given us to perform

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The two women and the Thessalonians are used as examples, but they are framed as 'signs' of Christ's victory rather than heroes of their own willpower.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides the theocentric reading: their acts are Christ's victory 'acting out' through them.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and hope; the burden of 'creating the future' is removed.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic foundation for synergistic living (God acts, therefore we act).

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The integration of apocalyptic cosmic victory with mundane ethical acts is seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'unjust destruction by man' and 'just judgment of God'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the Lord Jesus will slay him with the breath of his mouth

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit (via Christ) 'establishes' the heart, granting the 'Pouvoir-faire'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; Sin is a 'Power' and a 'Lawless One', not just a mistake.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon maintains God as the primary Subject of the cosmic narrative, while placing the hearer as the Subject of a secondary, dependent narrative of 'signs'.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly heavy on Savoir (explaining the Lawless One)
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain the current emphasis on Pouvoir (God's enabling).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Link the 'comfort' of the heart more explicitly to the 'power' to resist consumerism.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The high stakes of the opponent make the grace of the Subject more 'costly' and necessary.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Christ slays evil) → Ethics (We act out signs).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in avoiding moralism while maintaining high ethical urgency. By making God the Subject of the future, the preacher empowers the hearer to act without the crushing weight of self-redemption.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the Schell quote's pathos; Greimas shows that the quote functions to define the 'Opponent' as cosmic rather than trivial.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the 'Lawless One'; semiotics explains that the 'Lawless One' is the structural necessity that requires a Divine Subject (Christ) rather than a Human Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'good works' are not the Object of the sermon, but a 'Helper' (sign) to the primary Object of 'Restoration'.

appendices.notities: The sermon explicitly rejects the 'Subject-switch' common in modern spirituality (from God creating to Man creating).
